summary: Ecosystem explores the interconnected systems found in nature and their application to human design and society. It emphasizes collaboration, sustainability, and regenerative principles. This concept draws inspiration from natural processes to create adaptive, self-renewing systems across various domains. By understanding and mimicking nature's patterns, we can develop more resilient and harmonious approaches to architecture, urban planning, business, and community development. Ecosystem thinking promotes a holistic view that balances human needs with environmental stewardship.
excerpt: Ecosystem architecture challenges us to reconsider our relationship with nature and each other. By adopting its principles, we can create systems that are not only sustainable but also adaptive and self-renewing, fostering vibrant and resilient communities.
